description: Entertainment industry claims (2025-2026): streaming, box office, music, gaming, media

cases.claim: Netflix remained the largest global subscription streaming service by paid memberships through 2025
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Netflix reported 300M+ paid memberships and continued subscriber growth in its Q4 2025 shareholder letter
Reuters coverage in 2025 described Netflix as the biggest streaming service by subscribers as it pushed into the 300M+ range

cases.claim: Global box office fully recovered to pre-pandemic levels by 2025
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Gower Street Analytics estimated 2025 global box office at ~$33.55B, still below 2019 levels
Industry projections for 2026 still implied a gradual recovery path rather than full normalization in 2025

cases.claim: AI-generated music uploads surged by 2025 and platforms began large-scale detection and filtering
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Deezer said it was seeing ~10,000 AI-generated tracks uploaded per day and highlighted detection/labeling efforts
Streaming services faced rising pressure to curb AI-generated spam and impersonation-style uploads as volumes increased

cases.claim: Video games generated more revenue than film and recorded music combined in 2025
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Newzoo projected global games revenues of ~$188.8B for 2025
Global box office (2025 est. ~$33.55B) plus recorded music (2024: ~$29.6B) remains far below global games revenue scale

cases.claim: Podcast listenership peaked in 2022 and declined by 2025
cases.label: REFUTED

evidence_packets.summary: Edison Research’s Infinite Dial 2025 reported continued growth in podcast listening penetration (US) rather than a collapse
Podcast adoption in the US has trended upward over multiple years, with listening becoming mainstream across age groups

cases.claim: By 2025, streaming growth shifted from pure subscriber adds to bundling and price/plan optimization
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Deloitte’s 2025 media trends highlighted consumer price sensitivity, churn pressure, and increasing bundle interest
Major platforms emphasized plan design (bundles/ad tiers) as a strategic lever as competition intensified

cases.claim: Vinyl record sales continued to exceed CD sales in the US (revenue) in the most recent annual results reported in 2025
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: RIAA year-end industry results showed vinyl revenue above CD revenue (continuing the multi-year trend)
RIAA reporting again underscored vinyl’s sustained revenue lead over CDs in the modern physical market

cases.claim: Broadway attendance and grosses exceeded pre-pandemic highs by 2025
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Broadway League season reporting has shown recovery, but whether it surpasses 2018-19 depends on season selection and metric (gross vs attendance)
Post-pandemic Broadway performance remains sensitive to tourism cycles, pricing mix, and show slate; blanket “exceeded highs” claims vary by metric

cases.claim: Consumers showed subscription fatigue in 2025, with stronger price sensitivity and higher churn risk
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Deloitte’s 2025 survey highlighted consumers cutting back, rotating services, and reacting strongly to price increases
Bundling and ad tiers were positioned as responses to fatigue/churn dynamics

cases.claim: Global recorded music revenue continued its growth streak through 2024 results (reported in 2025)
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: IFPI reported global recorded music revenues of ~$29.6B for 2024, extending a multi-year growth run driven largely by streaming
IFPI highlighted continued streaming-led expansion as the core driver of industry growth

cases.claim: Ad-supported tiers reached mass scale by 2025 across major streamers
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Reuters reported Netflix’s ad-supported plan reached ~94M monthly active users in 2025
Disney announced ~157M monthly active users across its ad-supported tiers (Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+)

cases.claim: Short-form video (TikTok-style) became a primary music discovery channel for Gen Z by 2025
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: MIDi Research reported TikTok as a leading music discovery platform among Gen Z in the US/UK
TikTok/Luminate reported large shares of Gen Z using TikTok for music discovery and highlighted platform impact on charts

cases.claim: Superhero movies in the 2020s became more hit-driven and less reliably “automatic blockbusters” than the pre-2020 era
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: A longitudinal analysis found 2020–2025 domestic box office dynamics differed from 1980–2019 patterns, indicating structural shifts in performance predictability
Industry commentary increasingly frames “superhero fatigue” as volatility and quality/event-dependence rather than total audience disappearance

cases.claim: Reality/unscripted content remained capable of dominating streaming attention in 2025
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Deadline (citing Nielsen) reported Netflix’s ‘Love Is Blind’ Season 8 logged ~1B+ viewing minutes in a single week in 2025
High-volume weekly viewing minutes for reality franchises demonstrates continued mainstream pull in the streaming era

cases.claim: Live music remained at or near record revenue levels in the most recent global reporting (2024 results published 2025)
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Pollstar’s year-end reporting showed continued record-scale touring revenues post-pandemic, with top tours driving outsized gross
Ongoing high ticket prices and stadium-scale demand kept global touring revenue elevated in 2024/2025 comparisons

cases.claim: Esports investment remained well below the 2021 peak through 2025
cases.label: INSUFFICIENT

evidence_packets.summary: Public reporting indicates esports funding cooled materially post-2021, but consistent cross-source 2025 totals vary by definition (org vs game vs infra)
Market sizing disagreements (sponsorship vs media rights vs in-game esports) make hard “single-number” contraction claims fragile

cases.claim: Audiobook sales resumed strong growth (2024 results published in 2025), outperforming many other book formats
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Audio Publishers Association reported 2024 audiobook revenue of ~$2.22B (+~13% YoY), driven by digital audio
Industry survey data noted digital audiobooks as ~99% of revenue and a return to double-digit growth

cases.claim: The volume of shared deepfakes surged dramatically by 2025, prompting new regulation and detection initiatives in 2026
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Reuters reported shared deepfakes rising from ~500,000 in 2023 to ~8 million in 2025 (UK government data cited)
UK policy actions and enforcement escalated, including criminalization of certain non-consensual deepfake imagery and push for detection standards

cases.claim: Anime remained mainstream in the West and continued expanding via major platforms through 2025-2026
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Sony/Crunchyroll reporting indicated Crunchyroll reached ~17M paid subscribers (showing continued scale growth)
Crunchyroll implemented additional price increases in 2026, signaling pricing power and sustained demand

cases.claim: Trust in traditional news media remained low into 2026 across many markets
cases.label: SUPPORTED

evidence_packets.summary: Edelman Trust Barometer 2026 continued to report weak trust levels for media relative to other institutions
News avoidance and fragmented consumption patterns continued to be highlighted as structural challenges for traditional news models
